com.instil.lgi
Class Block

java.lang.Object
  com.instil.lgi.Block

public class Block
extends java.lang.Object

Basic node of a parsed tree. It contains information about the content and type of Block. Also, it has a list of children. Every String processed by a parser will be transformed into a parsed tree, and thus is accessible from the Blocks by means of getText(). The specific region in the text that this Block has transformed into a node in the tree is between the indices of getBegin() (inclusive) and getEnd() (exclusive).

Author:
Edgar A Duenez-Guzman

Field Detail

NO_PARSE

public static final Block NO_PARSE
This is the no-parse Block. It is returned by parsing grammars when the parsing of a String fails. It is safe to compare directly using the == and != operators against this Block to test for parsing errors.

Constructor Detail

Block

public Block()
Creates a new instance of Block with empty operator and with no children.

Block

public Block(java.lang.String text,
             int begin,
             int end)
Creates a new instance of Block with the specified region in the provided, String as the parsed area of the String. By convention, all sub-Blocks should refer to the same String reference, and use a subset (not necessarily proper) of the portion used by this Block. This is not enforced though.

Parameters:
text - The reference to the parsed String that generated this Block.
begin - The starting (inclusive) position in the String corresponding to the contents of this Block.
end - The ending (exclusive) position in the String corresponding to the contents of this Block.

Block

public Block(java.lang.String text,
             int begin,
             int end,
             int type,
             Block[] child)

Creates a new instance of Block with the specified String and region as parsed contents, the Block will be set to the specified type, and will add the Blocks given in the array as its children.

By convention, all sub-Blocks should refer to the same String reference, and use a subset (not necessarily proper) of the portion used by this Block. This is not enforced though.

Parameters:
text - The reference to the parsed String that generated this Block.
begin - The starting (inclusive) position in the String corresponding to the contents of this Block.
end - The ending (exclusive) position in the String corresponding to the contents of this Block.
type - The numerical type to be given to this Block.
child - The array of children. These will be referenced and not copied. The array can be null or of length zero in which case, the Block will be considered a terminal (leaf) node.
Method Detail

trimChildren

public void trimChildren()
Frees the non required memory used by the Vector of children by trimming to fit the number of children. This function resets the terminal status of the block to true if and only if the number of children is zero.

See Also:
Vector.trimToSize()

addChild

public void addChild(Block block)
Adds the specified Block to the end of list of children of this node. If the same Block is added to 2 or more Blocks (even if it is the same) in the same parsed tree the results are undefined. This function only references the Block, and does not copy it.

Parameters:
block - The Block to be added as child of this Block.

removeChild

public void removeChild(int i)
Removes the specified child, and shifts right any subsequent children.

Parameters:
i - The index of the child to remove.

getChild

public Block getChild(int i)
Gets the child in position i of the list of children. This function returns the direct reference to the child and not a copy.

Parameters:
i - The index of the child to get.
Returns:
The i-th child of this block.

getType

public int getType()
Gets the type (id) of this Block. This is used by the user, presumably to group Block with similar features into one type to handle them in the same way while executing them.

Returns:
The type of the Block.

setType

public void setType(int t)
Sets the type (id) of this Block to the specified value.

Parameters:
t - The new type of this Block.

getNumChildren

public int getNumChildren()
Gets the total number of children Blocks in this Block.

Returns:
The number of children. They can then be accessed with indices from 0 to getNumChildren()-1.

getSubtext

public java.lang.String getSubtext()
Utility method that creates a copy of the region in the parsed String that this Block contains. This is equivalent to calling getText().substring( getBegin(), getEnd() )

Returns:
A copy of the region of interest as a String.

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
Gets the referenced String from which (at least) this Block and probably all its sub-Blocks. This method does not copy the String, and instead it returns a reference to it. The returned String should not be modified by the user.

Returns:
The parsed String from which this Block was created.

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String t)
Sets the reference String from which this Block was created. The provided String is references directly without making a copy of it.

Parameters:
t - The new reference to the text contained in this Block.

getUserObject

public java.lang.Object getUserObject()
Returns a reference to the user specified Object attached to this node.

Returns:
The user Object of this Block.

setUserObject

public void setUserObject(java.lang.Object u)
Sets a reference to the provided Object to be used as the user-defined data contained in this Block.

Parameters:
u - The new user Object for this Block.

getBegin

public int getBegin()
Gets the starting position in the text associated with this Block from which the contents of the node was generated.

Returns:
The starting index in the text.

setBegin

public void setBegin(int b)
Sets the starting position in the text associated with this Block from which the contents of the node was presumably generated.

Parameters:
b - The new starting index to be used.

getEnd

public int getEnd()
Gets the finishing position (exclusive) in the text associated with this Block from which the contents of the node was generated.

Returns:
The finishing index in the text.

setEnd

public void setEnd(int e)
Sets the finishing position (exclusive) in the text associated with this Block from which the contents of the node was presumably generated.

Parameters:
e - The new finishing index to be used.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the String representation of this Block by recursively calling this method in each children. This method is NOT thread safe.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
The String representation of this Block and its children.
